title: Podi Uttapam With Idly Batter | South Indian Pancake with Vegetable toppings | Breakfast 👩🏻‍🍳
content:
South Indian Breakfast Recipe: Podi Uttapam With Idly Batter/ Idly Batter Uttapam/ Podi Uttapam Servings: 4 Uttapam Duration: 15 mins Uttapam is one of my favorite South Indian breakfast when it is loaded with toppings such as onion, Carrot, cilantro, Capsicum/ bell pepper and final twist by sprinkling idly Podi on it.. so don't miss this lovely Uttapam, do try & let me know how it turned out to you 👩🏻‍🍳🙂 Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: To make Uttapam Batter:
  • Idly Batter  - 500 ml
  • Idly Podi  - 100 gms
  • Rice Flour - 1/4 cup - 60 gms
  • Water - 60 ml
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
Toppings: Finely chopped 
  • Green chillies - 2
  • Onion - 1/2 cup - 120 gms
  • Yellow Bell pepper/ Capsicum - 1/2
  • Carrot - 1/4 cup
  • Cilantro - 1/4 cup
  • Ghee/ oil - To cook Uttapam
Procedure:
  • Take idly batter in a mixing bowl
  • Add rice flour, water & salt in it, mix well
  • Keep batter aside
  • Heat tawa either cast iron/ non stick over medium heat
  • Sprinkle water and wipe off with onion/ paper towel
  • Smear tawa with 1 tsp oil and wipe off with paper towel
  • Now add 1 full ladle of prepared batter, spread round shape as shown in picture
  • Uttapam is a thick South Indian pancake, you can also spread them into thin crepe if  you wish so but only drawback is toppings won't stick to Uttapam 🙃
  • Add toppings all together/ one by one it's your choice
  • Cover with lid and cook till bottom of Uttapam changes to golden brown
  • Sprinkle 2 tb sp Idly Podi and apply oil/ ghee
  • Press with spatula to stick Podi on Uttapam
  • Flip carefully and cook the other side for about 30 secs or till it cooks completely
  • Serve with coconut chutney/Coriander Coconut Chutney/ Tomato 🍅 Chutney
  • Happy Cooking 👩🏻‍🍳 & Enjoy your day 😍
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Batter should be semi thickness ( not pouring) consistency
  • You can also make Uttapam with Dosa batter by following same process only thing you need to skip rice flour & water
  • Toppings are all your choice like green Capsicum, spring onions, tomato, mint or anything you could wish to have 😋
